title: Sidney986
author: Sidney986
content: Electrum on AndroidI sent a small bitcoin payment to test a wallet and the minimum slider fee was much higher than medium or higher fee on the mempool.  There is no manual option to set the miner fee on the Android version of Electrum.  Developer please add this option.Also another option I would like is setting to be at GBP rather than sats on the pay/amount screen as it gets very annoying having to switch every time I make a payment.  A settings option to toggle this would be good.Can I also have the amount show also in GBP on the final screen where I select to transmit the payment.Electrum Version tested 4.3.4

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: Quote from: Sidney986 on July 14, 2023, 12:26:43 PMI sent a small bitcoin payment to test a wallet and the minimum slider fee was much higher than medium or higher fee on the mempool.  There is no manual option to set the miner fee on the Android version of Electrum. You can't set the fee rate manually on android version of electrum, but you can change the fee estimation method to static and set the fee rate to 1, 2, 5,10,.... sat/vbyte. Quote from: Sidney986 on July 14, 2023, 12:26:43 PMAlso another option I would like is setting to be at GBP rather than sats on the pay/amount screen as it gets very annoying having to switch every time I make a payment.  A settings option to toggle this would be good.Tap on the circle located at top right corner of the screen and go to "Preferences". Enable "Fiat Currency" and set the currency to GBP.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: After you set the fiat to GBP, you can input the amount that you want to send in GBP If you want to be able to customize the fee, you have to use desktop Electrum. Or you can use Bluewallet if you think the fee slider is not accurate enough.Quote from: hosseinimr93 on July 14, 2023, 12:41:10 PMYou can't set the fee rate manually on android version of electrum, but you can change the fee estimation method to static and set the fee rate to 1, 2, 5,10,.... sat/vbyte. The higher the fee rate to be used, the less the accuracy of the static fee rate. It would have been nice if Electrum developers make the fee to be customizable.

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: I asked this question several months ago and you will find many answers to it Android Electrum manually editing fee In short, I did not find a way to manually adjust the fees on the Android version, so using an alternative wallet is the appropriate option, and they may add this feature in future versions.

comments.body: Quote from: Sidney986 on July 14, 2023, 12:26:43 PMElectrum Version tested 4.3.4You are using an older version of Electrum maybe some features on 4.3.4 is not the same as the newer version.Would you mind to update it first to the latest version and try againAbout the manual fee there are 3 options on finalize page ETA, Mempool and Static look at the image belowInstead of using manual/static, I suggest use mempool and always set it to 1mb below from the tip to avoid stuck transactions.

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: Quote from: Sidney986 on July 14, 2023, 04:26:27 PMThat's help a lot, but the developer has not made that function obvious with everything in white text.You are right. That has been designed very badly. If you update your electrum to version 4.4.0 or versions after that, you will see that the UI has been designed much better, however it still lacks many features of the desktop version. Quote from: BitMaxz on July 14, 2023, 04:30:31 PMInstead of using manual/static, I suggest use mempool and always set it to 1mb below from the tip to avoid stuck transactions.It's not a good idea to always set the target to 1 MB from the tip. Sometimes, you are not in hurry and you can save some amount of bitcoin with paying lower fees. And whether you are in hurry or not, it would be better to check the mempool yourself and not only rely on electrum's estimation.
